headers.subject: [mule-user] HTTP Pass-through Proxy Problems

body.para: Hi, I'm trying to get mule (3.0.0 M4) to deploy as a web service 'pass-through' HTTP proxy.
It works fine when deployed an HTTP bridge; but that's not suitable for what I'm trying to do and so I need to use the HTTP connector proxy parameters. My config looks like this:
The idea is to throw any HTTP SOAP call to 'localhost' on port 8088 and have this web service call proxied through to a second server running on IP address xx.xx.xx.xx port 8060.
But when deploying I'm getting errors (below including a hint) , which I think is probably something to do with missing parameters in my Http Connector.

Caused by: org.mule.api.MuleRuntimeException: Failed to lookup beans of type interface org.mule.api.registry. TransformerResolver from the Spring registry at org.mule.config.spring.SpringRegistry.lookupByType(SpringRegistry.java:190) at org.mule.config.spring.SpringRegistry.lookupObjects(SpringRegistry.java:176) at org.mule.registry.AbstractRegistryBroker.lookupObjects(AbstractRegistryBroker.java:135) at org.mule.registry.MuleRegistryHelper.lookupObjects(MuleRegistryHelper.java:592) at org.mule.registry.MuleRegistryHelper.notifyTransformerResolvers(MuleRegistryHelper.java:378) at org.mule.registry.MuleRegistryHelper.registerTransformer(MuleRegistryHelper.java:371) at org.mule.config.bootstrap.SimpleRegistryBootstrap.registerTransformers(SimpleRegistryBootstrap.java:238) at org.mule.config.bootstrap.SimpleRegistryBootstrap.initialise(SimpleRegistryBootstrap.java:165) ... 40 more

Caused by: org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'ref:HttpConnectorProxy.15': 1 constructor arguments specified but no matching constructor found in bean 'ref:HttpConnectorProxy.15' (hint: specify index and/or type arguments for simple parameters to avoid type ambiguities)
body.footer:
